refnamediv.refpurpose: Script to install a Kirby kit to a new virtual host directory

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: This manual page documents briefly the &dhpackage; command, which is part of the kirbytools1 package.

&dhpackage; is a script that will install a Kirby package to a new virtual host directory. The package will be downloaded first if it is not already on the local machine by means of the kirbydownload1 script. You can specify the package to install and the virtual host directory where it should be installed to.

Optionally, you can force the download even if a package of the same kit and version is already on your local machine, and you can replace the kirby program directory with a symbolic link to a folder with kirby program directories.

Default values for these options will be set by the kirbyconfigure1 script, which will be called upon first invocation of any of the kirbytools scripts. The values will be saved in the file $HOME/.kirbyrc.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS
refsect1.para: The script follows the usual GNU command line syntax, options always starting with a dash (`-').

listitem.para: Replace the kirby program directory of the installed kit to a folder with kirby program directories. The location defaults to the value of KIRBYLIBDIR (appended with the versionnumber), which has been configured by the kirbyconfigure1 script and which is saved in the file $HOME/.kirbyrc.

This makes sense if you would like to create multiple virtual hosts which are based on the same Kirby version. The kirby program directory will then only be linked into the virtual host folder. See the Kirby cookbook recipe about multisite installations for further details.
Force download even if the package is already downloaded. Standard behavior is to skip downloading if the package is already in KIRBYDOWNLOADDIR.
Specify which Kirby package to install. Defaults to the value of $KIRBYKIT-$KIRBYVERSION, which have been configured by the kirbyconfigure1 script and which are saved in the file $HOME/.kirbyrc.

Specify the name of the virtual host directory to install to. Defaults to a random value of lowercase letters prefixed by $KIRBYSUFFIX, which has been configured by the kirbyconfigure1 script and which is saved in the file $HOME/.kirbyrc.
The value must conform to a valid directory name, wich will be used as a subdirectory of the virtual hosts root folder as defined by $KIRBYVHOSTROOT in the file $HOME/.kirbyrc.
The system-wide configuration file to control the behaviour of &dhpackage;.
The per-user configuration file to control the behaviour of &dhpackage;. This file will be created by the kirbyconfigure script (see kirbyconfigure1) if it does not exist.

refsect1.title: BUGS
refsect1.para: Currently, only Kirby 3 starterkits and plainkits are supported.
The programs are currently limited to work with the apache2 httpd.
Some functionality requires root (or sudo as root) access.
